head.supplied: Woollandibby ¶ 2/2/90. ¶ ¶ […] ¶ ¶ Re the species of Panax I beg to say that if it is any variety at all, it would be rather a var. of Pan. sambucifolia than Pan. Murrayi; […] Since I wrote last [18...

div.p: MRS 203/1, Inwards correspondence — special bundles, 1886-1921, 90/51. Archives of the Powerhouse Museum, Sydney

Re the species of Panax I beg to say that if it is any variety at all, it would be rather a var. of Pan. sambucifolia than Pan. Murrayi; […] Since I wrote last [18/1]; I obtained flowering specimens also, so that I was able to send both flowering and fruiting specimens to Baron von Muller to have the species determined. In doing so I pointed out to him two characteristics, which, I should think, should separate it from Pan. samb., to say nothing of its quite different mode of occurrence. The first characteristic is its production of gum, which I never yet noticed in Pan. samb. in any of its varieties.
The second characteristic is this; that it never varies in the shape of its leaves, […]
According to Baron von Muller, there exists some difficulty in obtaining the seed of A. binervata, plentiful though as the tree is in its localities. […]
